Key Match Events: India won by eight wickets with 46 balls remaining.
Jasprit Bumrah was named Player of the Match.
Rohit Sharma retired hurt after scoring 52.
Rishabh Pant scored 36 not out, ending the match with a reverse lap for six.
Jasprit Bumrah took 2 wickets for 6 runs in 3 overs.
Hardik Pandya took 2 wickets, including a hat-trick ball.
Arshdeep Singh took 2 wickets in his first over.
Rohit Sharma and Rishabh Pant were both hit multiple times by the ball due to the pitch conditions.
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and chose to bowl first.
The pitch had green patches and overcast conditions, favoring bowlers.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma commented on the pitch conditions and his injury, stating it was important to get used to the conditions and stick to basics.
Paul Stirling mentioned the difficulty of the pitch and the importance of upcoming games for Ireland.
Jasprit Bumrah expressed happiness with the conditions and the team's performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch in New York was problematic, with uneven bounce and dangerous conditions for batters.
The ICC may need to address the pitch conditions before the next game between India and Pakistan.
